questions.instruction:
[b]Questions 1–6.[\b]

Complete the form below

Write [b]ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER[/b] for each answer.

[b]Questions 7–10[/b]

Complete the table below.

Write [b]ONE WORD ONLY[/b] for each answer.

[b]Questions 11–16[/b]

What information is given about each of the following festival workshops?

Choose [b]SIX[/b] answers from the box and write the correct letter, [b]A–H[/b], next to Questions 11–16.

options.label: A
options.value: involves painting and drawing

options.label: B
options.value: will be led by a prize-winning author

options.label: C
options.value: is aimed at children with a disability

options.label: D
options.value: involves a drama activity

options.label: E
options.value: focuses on new relationships

options.label: F
options.value: is aimed at a specific age group

options.label: G
options.value: explores an unhappy feeling

options.label: H
options.value: raises awareness of a particular culture

multiple_mcq.question: Which TWO pieces of advice does the speaker give to parents about reading?

options.label: A
options.value: Encourage children to write down new vocabulary.

options.label: B
options.value: Allow children to listen to audio books.

options.label: C
options.value: Get recommendations from librarians.

options.label: D
options.value: Give children a choice about what they read.

options.label: E
options.value: Only read aloud to children until they can read independently.

multiple_mcq.question: Which TWO reasons does the speaker give for recommending Alive and Kicking?

options.label: A
options.value: It will appeal to both boys and girls.

options.label: B
options.value: The author is well known.

options.label: C
options.value: It has colourful illustrations.

options.label: D
options.value: It is funny.

options.label: E
options.value: It deals with an important topic.

questions.instruction:
[b]Questions 21-25[/b]

Choose the correct letter, [b]A, B or C.[/b]

[b]Science experiment for Year 12 students[/b]

mcq.question: How does Clare feel about the students in her Year 12 science class?

options.label: A
options.value: worried that they are not making progress

options.label: B
options.value: challenged by their poor behaviour in class

options.label: C
options.value: frustrated at their lack of interest in the subject

mcq.question: How does Jake react to Clare’s suggestion about an experiment based on children’s diet?

options.label: A
options.value: He is concerned that the results might not be meaningful.

options.label: B
options.value: He feels some of the data might be difficult to obtain.

options.label: C
options.value: He suspects that the conclusions might be upsetting.

mcq.question: What problem do they agree may be involved in an experiment involving animals?

options.label: A
options.value: Any results may not apply to humans.

options.label: B
options.value: It may be complicated to get permission.

options.label: C
options.value: Students may not be happy about animal experiments.

mcq.question: What question do they decide the experiment should address?

options.label: A
options.value: Are mice capable of controlling their food intake?

options.label: B
options.value: Does an increase in sugar lead to health problems?

options.label: C
options.value: How much do supplements of different kinds affect health?

mcq.question: Clare might also consider doing another experiment involving

options.label: A
options.value: other types of food supplement.

options.label: B
options.value: different genetic strains of mice.

options.label: C
options.value: varying amounts of exercise.

extra: the breakdown of large pieces of plastic
the action of vehicle tyres on roads

fill_in_the_blanks_with_subtitle.subtitle: Effects of microplastics
extra: They cause injuries to the __________ of wildlife and affect their digestive systems.
They enter the food chain, e.g., in bottled and tap water, __________ and seafood.
They may not affect human health, but they are already banned in skin cleaning products and __________ in some countries.
Microplastics enter the soil through the air, rain and __________ .

fill_in_the_blanks_with_subtitle.subtitle: Microplastics in the soil – a study by Anglia Ruskin University
extra: Earthworms are important because they add __________ to the soil.
The study aimed to find whether microplastics in earthworms affect the __________ of plants.
The study found that microplastics caused:
- a rise in the level of __________ in the soil.
- soil should be seen as an important natural process.
- changes to soil damage both ecosystems and __________ .
